name: Grand Hotel Nord-Pinus

reviews.text: Lovely place ... wonderfully appointed w/ vintage bullfight posters and costumes ... great tubs and French-milled soap ... delicious food and wine ... convenient and a great location for touring Provence ... very romantic ... highly recommend this place ... check out the Web site it offers a very good depiction of what to expect. I'll be back!
reviews.title: One of the most romantic hotels in the world!

reviews.text: The hotel was really delightful. It sits right in the middle of Place du Forum with its many lovely restaurants and cafes. Our room was almost like an apartment. Christine who manages the hotel was so helpful to us. She helped us make arrangements when our trip needed to be changed and was really very kind. We will be back again to stay at this wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: The nicest manager we ever met

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel with lots of character and history, made more special by the warmth and friendliness of the hotel staff.
reviews.title: A lovely atmospheric hotel

reviews.text: It was rather costly for the quality of the room, but its location and its staff more than made up for this. We arrived in Arles having had 3 sleepless nights in Avignon, and asked for a quiet room which we got. We arrived nearly 3 hours early for check-in, but the receptionist was very good humoured and accommodating.
reviews.title: 1 star experience at 3 star hotel
Loved the Hotel Nord Pinus
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on our last evening - very lovely food and wine. Breakfast is expensive (14 euro for continental) but you can have a leisurely meal - no-one is rushing you and the quality is worth it (we preferred it to the 5 euro breakfast in a nearby bar, where people were smoking whilst we ate).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a long weekend, the super location on one of the few squares in Arles, the very nice management and good service. Good rooms, large bathrooms, nothing styling but of good quality. Excellent breakfast (especially the baguettes!), good advice and help available at the front desk re trips etc.. This is the place where the toreros used to stay - they knew why... We would go back if we stayed in Arles again.
reviews.title: cool place with history, the best location and nice people
a unique experience!
reviews.text: Loved this place! We stayed in room 10 -the Bullfighters Room, with a narrow balcony overlooking the square. The room where those famous bullfighters stood to receive the accolades of the crowds below , where Napoleon once slept (well, the bed is suitably short), where Charlotte Rampling's bare bottom graced the furniture when she posed nude for Helmut Newton and where Picasso took his bath -yep, he must have been splashed by the gushy taps too! Antique furnishings, placed with care by an artistic eye. Bathroom old fashioned but fine and spacious. Yummy breakfasts on the terrace and a manageress who is engagingly friendly, helpful and knowledgeable are strong plus points. I can understand, having read other reviews, that this is not the type of hotel everyone will enjoy. Some complain the prices are too high for grandeur so faded. Be warned, if you want mod cons and perfect maintenance, go stay elsewhere, with smart modern, although probably uniform, bathrooms and bedrooms filled with flat screen tvs and wireless internet. At these prices, yes you can surely get that elsewhere. But for me, and many others like me, the Nord Pinus is heavenly, even without those things. Like living and breathing a funky, glamourous history lesson, I adored staying there. Every nook is furnished with eclectic objects and historic fittings, but the hotel does not have a manufactured "retro" ambience. It is not some kit interior or exterior faked up in decorator " shabby chic". This is the real deal - a piece of the town's history -with a bohemian charm and glamour that has formed over time and still remains. Now, if you think all that sounds a bit romantic and fanciful, ask yourself, next time you are sitting and a bland, boring hotel room, wouldn't an atmosphere of romance and fancy be so much better? -you are on holiday after all! Undeniably parts are a bit careworn and crumbly, but not to a degree that I found it a detraction at all. I tend to stay in deluxe hotels, so my standards are high and I would rather stay here in Arles than any other hotel in the area. Sitting on the terrace with a glass of champagne in the evening sun is simply such great fun! It is the coolest spot in town for people watching as folk pass through the square or settle into the restaurants. After dinner (the hotel does not have a restaurant, but there are plenty right on the doorstep) you can retreat into the bar where the Peter Beard wildlife photos are truly moving. Yes, it is expensive, so if you feel that the quirks of old buildings need to be ironed out smoothly for you to feel comfortable paying 300euros a night, don't take the chance - stay elsewhere. But if you want to soak up the unique atmosphere of a grand old legend of Arles, do give it a try.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pricey at the Grand Hotel Nord Pinus, but the ambiance and charm are worth it. I would add that the central location on the Place du Forum is a bonus and a great base for a stay in Arles.
reviews.title: relaxing and unique

reviews.text: The room was clean and well-appointed, and the bathroom clean and spacious as well. The bathtub was clogged when we first tried to use it, but once we told the management, they made every effort to address the problem in a timely manner. The staff were helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel but at a price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to agree with a previous reviewer - we liked the hotel - it was very characterful and we got a good idea of what it must have been like in its glory days - but you pay for it!
reviews.title: Lovely decor but lacking amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel! The decor is fascinating and eclectic; each guest room is different and both the rooms and public spaces are outfitted with art and antiques bought at auction. It is full of fascinating treasures, such as the photographs by Peter Beard that line the walls of the bar.The atmosphere is wonderful, the rooms comfortable, and the service excellent. The proprietess, Emanuelle, was so savvy, and her recommendations for restaurants and shopping were right on. We loved the location. It was the best hotel of our two week visit to France. It was a unique experience that we won't forget.
reviews.title: Quirky and wonderful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed here for 2 nights. there was some character to the hotel. the location was ideal. there were lots of staff of reception etc. the decor and the bar were lovely but noone ever seemed to be using them and there wasn't as much atmosphere are you imagine there once had been.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bathroom was lovely , great big bath
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Top price for a 4mtr by 4mtr room where you can't open the wardrobe door because the bed is in the way and you are afraid to open the shutters for fear they may fall off. This Hotel is a grand looking building but a bit stuffy and old fashioned which in its self is no problem but I would not have awarded it four stars. Parking at 17 euro is 6 euros higher than hotels 100 mtrs away. Look at other hotels not far from this one before you book.
reviews.title: Top Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this hotel as featured in "Living in Provence" book. Many famous people have stayed here,I'm not surprised it's wonderful. We stayed one night, but wished we'd booked 2/3 nights. Fantastic staff, especially the lady manager. Our room, although very reasonable was very comfortable, air con and ceiling fan. Very comfortable bed! Huge bathroom, although no proper shower? Can't wait to book again! Garage parking very swish, but don't take your Range Rover! Fantastic location right in the centre of 'Van Gogh' land! A perfect hotel for a romantic get away.
reviews.title: Lots of character at the Nord Pinus

reviews.text: We only stayed one night in Arles and for us that was enough. The hotel is uniquely decorated. Very clean and well appointed. The staff were extremely helpful and nice.
reviews.title: Unique Hotel in a great location.

reviews.text: Delightfully situated in the Place du Forum, the hotel offers it all, Charm, History, Comfort and staff who were so helpful during our stay with recommendations of great restaurants in Arles, places to visit , provision of train times and so much more.. After arriving by train in Arles, we struggled to find the hotel with the maze of charming history filled streets. (The key.... Rue 4 Septembre leads you virtually to the door or alternatively follow the river)
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, Character filled Hotel, History laidened town !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having eventually found our way we were greeted by a smiling Samara (?) who offered us an upgrade which we gratefully accepted .......the room was full of character,clean, quiet and comfortable. We also were recommended a restaurant Le Gabouchet (?) which was exteremely good and reasonable.
reviews.title: Charming - a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Rich character and central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our onward travel to Cannes and Nice .........staying at the Majestic Barriere !! struggled to keep up with the standards set by the Grand Nord Pinus.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by their web site...

description: Small hotel with Old World Charm in building dating from 1850; restaurant; multilingual staff; located in city center.
